-              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="5"></li>
-              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="6"></li>
-            </ol>
-            <div class="carousel-inner">
-                <div class="carousel-item active" data-step="1">
-                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="First slide">
-                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
-                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
-                        <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> Welcome! </h1>
-                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
-                            <p> Greetings! We hope you are excited to begin your university experience at UWA! It is an honour for us to have you.</p> <br>
-                            <p> Continue reading by clicking the next icon on the right of this slide to see our next slide which will begin our How-To Course on everything you need to know about enrolling at UWA! You can also navigate from slide to slide by selecting one of the below buttons to navigate to a specific slide.</p> <br>
-                            <p> Are you a year 12 student? Ensure to continuously check the course requirements of the course you wish to enrol in and ensure that you are taking the necessary ATAR prerequisites for that course. </p>
-                            <ul>
-                                <li style="padding-left:15px;">If you are not taking the prerequisite ATAR subjects that your course requires, there are still ways that you can do them at UWA as bridging units. Consult UWA Student Assistance staff to plan out your course if this is the case. </li>
-                            </ul>
-                        </div>
-                    </div>
-                </div>
-                <div class="carousel-item" data-step="2">
-                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Second slide">
-                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
-                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
-                        <h1 style="text-decoration: underline; margin-top:10px;"> Step 1: Accepting your UWA Offer </h1>
-                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
-                            <p> Throughout the next few slides, we'll be going over the entire enrolment process for your undergraduate degree, as well as some course definitions that are handy to know.</p> <br>
-                            <ol>
-                                <li> The first step is to accept your UWA offer in your initial offer email. Your email would have been given to the University via. your application or your TISC preferences if you are a year 12 student. </li>
-                                <li> In your acceptance letter, you will have a student number. You will use this number to create your Pheme account which you will use throughout your degree to access online UWA material. </li>
-                                <li> Click on "Accept Offer" and create your your Pheme account. You will be asked to create a password and once created, log-in and continue your enrolment online. (Next Slide) </li>
-                                <li> If you are a domestic student, make sure to keep your <b> Tax File Number </b> handy if you wish to apply for Commonwealth-Supported course payment (HECS-HELP). </li> 
-                            </ol>
-                        </div>
-                    </div>
-                </div>
-                <div class="carousel-item" data-step="3">
-                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Third slide">
-                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
-                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
-                        <h1 style="text-decoration: underline; margin-top:10px;"> Step 2: Majors - Part 1  </h1>
-                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:25px;">
-                            <p style="margin-bottom: 15px;"> Now that we've set up our Pheme account, let's take a step back and consider which Major we would like to undertake in our Bachelor's degree. </p>
-                            <ul>
-                                <li> At UWA, you have the option of choosing from a wide choice of majors for each bachelor you undertake. As defined by UWA, a major is a structured sequence of units in a particular discipline or field of study. </li>
-                                <li> You can do up to two majors, and also have the choice of doing one major and a minor, two majors and a minor, or one major and an assortment of electives and/or broadening units. </li>
-                                    <li style="margin-left:30px;"> The number of majors you do will largely affect the structure of your course. For example, if you take a double major, almost all of the units you choose will be from each major, leaving less room for electives than if you only choose one degree-specific major.</li>
-                                <li> A minor is a much smaller unit set that is usually composed of only four units that you can optionally take as a part of your course. </li>
-                            </ul>
-                        </div>
-                    </div>
-                </div>
-                <div class="carousel-item" data-step="4">
-                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Fourth slide">
-                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
-                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
-                        <h1 style="text-decoration: underline; margin-top:10px;"> Step 2: Majors - Part 2  </h1>
-                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:25px;">
-                            <ul>
-                                <li> The first major you pick will be your degree-specific major and must fall under the course or Bachelor that you are enrolling for. </li>
-                                <li style="margin-left:30px;"> For example if you were undertaking a Bachelor of Science, you could choose Data Science as your degree-specific major. </li>
-                                <li> If you would like to browse the large selection of majors and their units, feel free to browse the UWA undergraduate handbook at
-                                    <a href="https://handbooks.uwa.edu.au/" alt=UWAHandbooks target="_blank"> handbooks.uwa.edu.au </a></li>
-                                <li> <b> Please note:</b> if you are undertaking a second major, you do not need to complete the complementary units for that major, whereas it is necessary to complete ALL units (including complementary) for your degree-specific major. </li>
-                            </ul>
-                        </div>
-                    </div>
-                </div>
-                <div class="carousel-item" data-step="5">
-                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Fifth slide">
-                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
-                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
-                        <h1 style="font-size: 27px; text-decoration: underline; margin-top:10px;"> Step 3: Understanding Course Requirements and Units - Part 1  </h1>
-                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:25px; font-size:16px;">
-                            <p> Another aspect of enrolling in your degree is selecting your units. In this section we'll be going over the types of units that you'll be making up your degree with and the requirements of your course. </p>
-                            <ol style="margin-top:15px;">
-                                <li> In order to finish your degree, you must satisfy the requirements of your course. The first requirement being that you complete all the core and complementarity units of your degree-specific major and/or the core units (AT LEAST) of your second major.</li>
-                                <li> Achieve 144 credit points throughout the duration of your course. Most units will be worth 6 credit points, and in order to complete your course in 3 years, the load is 4 units per semester (full-time). </li>
-                                <p style="list-style-type:circle; margin-left:30px;"> <b> Please note</b>: it is not mandatory to complete your course in 3 years, if you would like to extend one semester or one year, you may distribute your units throughout your degree in order to lighten your unit load per semester.  </p>
-                                <li> Complete at least four units (24 points) outside your degree specific major to satisfy the broadening requirement. </li>
-                                <li style="list-style-type:circle; margin-left:30px;"> If you are doing a degree-specific major and a second major, or a degree-specific major and a minor, don't worry! The broadening requirement will most likely already be completed for you by choosing a second major/minor, as those units would count towards your broadening requirement.</li>
-                            </ol> 
-                        </div>
-                    </div>
-                </div>
-                <div class="carousel-item" data-step="6">
-                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Sixth slide">
-                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
-                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
-                        <h1 style="font-size:27px; text-decoration: underline; margin-top:10px;"> Step 3: Understanding Course Requirements and Units - Part 2  </h1>
-                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:25px;">
-                            <ul>
-                                <li> Other course requirements that you should know are that: </li>
-                                <li style="list-style-type: upper-latin; margin-left:50px;"> You must not complete more than 12 level 1 units throughout your course and </li>
-                                <li style="list-style-type: upper-latin; margin-left:50px;"> You must pass at least four units at level 3. </li>
-                                <li> Each level typically corresponds to the difficulty of the unit and the year it is undertaken. E.g. Level 1 units are usually the easiest in difficulty and are taken in first year. </li>
-                                <li> Once you have chosen your degree-specific units and/or your second-major or broadening units, you can make up the rest of your units in electives to achieve the credit point. </li>
-                                    <li style="margin-left:30px;"> Electives range from a wide variety of fun and interesting units, ranging from philosophy in units such as PHIL1003 “God, Mind, and Knowledge” to learning about the universe in SCIE1121 “Our Universe”!  </li>
-                            </ul>
-                        </div>
-                    </div>
-                </div>
-                <div class="carousel-item" data-step="7">
-                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Seventh slide">
-                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
-                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
-                        <h1 style="text-decoration: underline; margin-top:10px;"> Step 4: Creating a Study Plan  </h1>
-                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:25px;">
-                            <p> Once you have chosen the majors, minors, broadening units and or electives that you wish to undertake, plan out the units in which you with to enrol using a study plan! Keep in mind that you can only enrol for one calendar year at a time, however you can plan out your entire degree in a study plan. </p>
-                            <p> A study plan is a list of units you want to enrol in over the course of your degree - it may look like this: (Click on either to open a downloadable study plan pdf) </p>
-                            <a href="https://handbooks.uwa.edu.au/docs/Course-Study-Plan-and-Checklist.pdf" target="_blank">
-                                <img src="{{ url_for('static', filename='Images/CourseStudyPlan1.png')}}" alt="CoursePlan1" style="width:350px; height:250px; float:left;"> 
-                                <img src="{{ url_for('static', filename='Images/CourseStudyPlan2.png')}}" alt="CoursePlan2" style="width:350px; height:250px; padding-left:5px;">
-                            </a>
-                        </div>
-                    </div>
-                </div>
-                <a class="carousel-control-prev" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="prev">
-                <span class="carousel-control-prev-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
-                <span class="sr-only">Previous</span>
-                </a>
-                <a class="carousel-control-next" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="next">
-                <span class="carousel-control-next-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
-                <span class="sr-only">Next</span>
-                </a>
-                <script>
-                    var totalSlides = 7;
-                    $('#myCarousel').carousel();
-

-

\ No newline at end of file
+    submit = SubmitField("Sign In")
+
+class RegistrationForm(FlaskForm): 
+    email = StringField("Email", validators=[DataRequired(), Email()])
+    name = StringField("Name", validators=[DataRequired()])
+    username = StringField("Username", validators=[DataRequired()])
+    dateofbirth = DateField("Date of Birth", validators=[DataRequired()])
+    password = PasswordField("Password", validators=[DataRequired()]) 
+    password2 = PasswordField(
+        "Repeat Password", validators=[DataRequired(), EqualTo("password")])
+    submit = SubmitField("Register") 
+
+    def validate_username(self, username):
+        user = User.query.filter_by(username=username.data).first()
+        if user is not None: 
+            raise ValidationError("Please select a different username.") 
+    
+    def validate_email(self, email): 
+        user = User.query.filter_by(email=email.data).first() 
+        if user is not None: 
+            raise ValidationError("Please enter a different email address.")

-    return render_template("welcome-registration.html",  title="Create an Account")
+    if current_user.is_authenticated:
+        return redirect(url_for("homePage"))
+    form = RegistrationForm()
+    if form.validate_on_submit(): 
+        user = User(username=form.username.data, email=form.email.data, name=form.name.data, dateofbirth=form.dateofbirth.data)
+        user.set_password(form.password.data)
+        db.session.add(user)
+        db.session.commit()
+        flash("Congratulations! You are not registered with UWA Advisor") 
+        return redirect(url_for("login"))
+    return render_template("welcome-registration.html",  title="Create an Account", form=form)

 }
 
+
+$(document).scroll(function() {
+stopScroll();                                                                           // Script to maintain side container doesn't scroll into footer
+});
+
+function stopScroll() {
+    if($('.side').offset().top + $('.side').height() >= $('footer').offset().top) {     // Takes offsets of each container (side and footer), and changes the position CSS element to either absolute or fixed)
+        $('.side').css('position', 'absolute')};
+    if($(document).scrollTop() + window.innerHeight < $('footer').offset().top){
+        $('.side').css('position', 'fixed')}; 
+}

new file mode 100644
index 0000000..ec9d45c
--- /dev/null
+++ b/migrations/alembic.ini
@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@
+# A generic, single database configuration.
+
+[alembic]
+# template used to generate migration files
+# file_template = %%(rev)s_%%(slug)s
+
+# set to 'true' to run the environment during
+# the 'revision' command, regardless of autogenerate
+# revision_environment = false
+
+
+# Logging configuration
+[loggers]
+keys = root,sqlalchemy,alembic,flask_migrate
+
+[handlers]
+keys = console
+
+[formatters]
+keys = generic
+
+[logger_root]
+level = WARN
+handlers = console
+qualname =
+
+[logger_sqlalchemy]
+level = WARN
+handlers =
+qualname = sqlalchemy.engine
+
+[logger_alembic]
+level = INFO
+handlers =
+qualname = alembic
+
+[logger_flask_migrate]
+level = INFO
+handlers =
+qualname = flask_migrate
+
+[handler_console]
+class = StreamHandler
+args = (sys.stderr,)
+level = NOTSET
+formatter = generic
+
+[formatter_generic]
+format = %(levelname)-5.5s [%(name)s] %(message)s
+datefmt = %H:%M:%S
diff --git a/migrations/env.py b/migrations/env.py
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..42438a5
--- /dev/null
+++ b/migrations/env.py
@@ -0,0 +1,90 @@
+from __future__ import with_statement
+
+import logging
+from logging.config import fileConfig
+
+from flask import current_app
+
+from alembic import context
+
+# this is the Alembic Config object, which provides
+# access to the values within the .ini file in use.
+config = context.config
+
+# Interpret the config file for Python logging.
+# This line sets up loggers basically.
+fileConfig(config.config_file_name)
+logger = logging.getLogger('alembic.env')
+
+# add your model's MetaData object here
+# for 'autogenerate' support
+# from myapp import mymodel
+# target_metadata = mymodel.Base.metadata
+config.set_main_option(
+    'sqlalchemy.url',
+    str(current_app.extensions['migrate'].db.engine.url).replace('%', '%%'))
+target_metadata = current_app.extensions['migrate'].db.metadata
+
+# other values from the config, defined by the needs of env.py,
+# can be acquired:
+# my_important_option = config.get_main_option("my_important_option")
+# ... etc.
+
+
+def run_migrations_offline():
+    """Run migrations in 'offline' mode.
+
+    This configures the context with just a URL
+    and not an Engine, though an Engine is acceptable
+    here as well.  By skipping the Engine creation
+    we don't even need a DBAPI to be available.
+
+    Calls to context.execute() here emit the given string to the
+    script output.
+
+    """
+    url = config.get_main_option("sqlalchemy.url")
+    context.configure(
+        url=url, target_metadata=target_metadata, literal_binds=True
+    )
+
+    with context.begin_transaction():
+        context.run_migrations()
+
+
+def run_migrations_online():
+    """Run migrations in 'online' mode.
+
+    In this scenario we need to create an Engine
+    and associate a connection with the context.
+
+    """
+
+    # this callback is used to prevent an auto-migration from being generated
+    # when there are no changes to the schema
+    # reference: http://alembic.zzzcomputing.com/en/latest/cookbook.html
+    def process_revision_directives(context, revision, directives):
+        if getattr(config.cmd_opts, 'autogenerate', False):
+            script = directives[0]
+            if script.upgrade_ops.is_empty():
+                directives[:] = []
+                logger.info('No changes in schema detected.')
+
+    connectable = current_app.extensions['migrate'].db.engine
+
+    with connectable.connect() as connection:
+        context.configure(
+            connection=connection,
+            target_metadata=target_metadata,
+            process_revision_directives=process_revision_directives,
+            **current_app.extensions['migrate'].configure_args
+        )
+
+        with context.begin_transaction():
+            context.run_migrations()
+
+
+if context.is_offline_mode():
+    run_migrations_offline()
+else:
+    run_migrations_online()

+"""${message}
+
+Revision ID: ${up_revision}
+Revises: ${down_revision | comma,n}
+Create Date: ${create_date}
+
+"""
+from alembic import op
+import sqlalchemy as sa
+${imports if imports else ""}
+
+# revision identifiers, used by Alembic.
+revision = ${repr(up_revision)}
+down_revision = ${repr(down_revision)}
+branch_labels = ${repr(branch_labels)}
+depends_on = ${repr(depends_on)}
+
+
+def upgrade():
+    ${upgrades if upgrades else "pass"}
+
+
+def downgrade():
+    ${downgrades if downgrades else "pass"}

+"""users table
+
+Revision ID: cb0ffb173571
+Revises: 
+Create Date: 2021-05-14 13:31:30.136558
+
+"""
+from alembic import op
+import sqlalchemy as sa
+
+
+# revision identifiers, used by Alembic.
+revision = 'cb0ffb173571'
+down_revision = None
+branch_labels = None
+depends_on = None
+
+
+def upgrade():
+    # ### commands auto generated by Alembic - please adjust! ###
+    op.create_table('user',
+    sa.Column('id', sa.Integer(), nullable=False),
+    sa.Column('username', sa.String(length=64), nullable=True),
+    sa.Column('email', sa.String(length=128), nullable=True),
+    sa.Column('password_hash', sa.String(length=128), nullable=True),
+    sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint('id')
+    )
+    op.create_index(op.f('ix_user_email'), 'user', ['email'], unique=True)
+    op.create_index(op.f('ix_user_username'), 'user', ['username'], unique=True)
+    # ### end Alembic commands ###
+
+
+def downgrade():
+    # ### commands auto generated by Alembic - please adjust! ###
+    op.drop_index(op.f('ix_user_username'), table_name='user')
+    op.drop_index(op.f('ix_user_email'), table_name='user')
+    op.drop_table('user')
+    # ### end Alembic commands ###

+from flask_wtf import FlaskForm
+from wtforms import StringField, PasswordField, BooleanField, SubmitField
+from wtforms.validators import DataRequired
+
+class LoginForm(FlaskForm):
+    username = StringField("Username", validators = [DataRequired()])
+    password =  PasswordField("Password", validators = [DataRequired()])
+    remember_me = BooleanFeild("Remember Me")
+    submit = SubmitField("Sign In")
\ No newline at end of file

+    if form.validate_on_submit():
+        flash('Login requested for user {}, remember_me={}'.format(
+            form.username.data, form.remember_me.data))
+        return redirect('/home')
+    return render_template("welcome-login.html", title="Sign in", form=form)
 
 @app.route("/registration")
 def registration():

diff --git a/app/static/Scripts/Postgradquiz.js b/app/static/Scripts/Postgradquiz.js
index e69de29..1cb0061 100644
--- a/app/static/Scripts/Postgradquiz.js
+++ b/app/static/Scripts/Postgradquiz.js
@@ -0,0 +1,171 @@
+(function(){
+    // Functions
+    function buildQuiz(){
+      // variable to store the HTML output
+      const output = [];
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach(
+        (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+          // variable to store the list of possible answers
+          const answers = [];
+  
+          // and for each available answer...
+          for(letter in currentQuestion.answers){
+  
+            // ...add an HTML radio button
+            answers.push(
+              `<label>
+                <input type="radio" name="question${questionNumber}" value="${letter}">
+                ${letter} :
+                ${currentQuestion.answers[letter]}
+              </label>`
+            );
+          }
+  
+          // add this question and its answers to the output
+          output.push(
+            `<div class="slideQuiz">
+              <div class="question"> ${currentQuestion.question} </div>
+              <div class="answers"> ${answers.join("")} </div>
+            </div>`
+          );
+        }
+      );
+  
+      // finally combine our output list into one string of HTML and put it on the page
+      quizContainer.innerHTML = output.join('');
+    }
+  
+    function showResults(){
+  
+      // gather answer containers from our quiz
+      const answerContainers = quizContainer.querySelectorAll('.answers');
+  
+      // keep track of user's answers
+      let numCorrect = 0;
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach( (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+        // find selected answer
+        const answerContainer = answerContainers[questionNumber];
+        const selector = `input[name=question${questionNumber}]:checked`;
+        const userAnswer = (answerContainer.querySelector(selector) || {}).value;
+  
+        // if answer is correct
+        if(userAnswer === currentQuestion.correctAnswer){
+          // add to the number of correct answers
+          numCorrect++;
+  
+          // color the answers green
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'lightgreen';
+        }
+        // if answer is wrong or blank
+        else{
+          // color the answers red
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'red';
+        }
+      });
+  
+      // show number of correct answers out of total
+      resultsContainer.innerHTML = `${numCorrect} out of ${myQuestions.length} correct`;
+    }
+  
+    function showSlide(n) {
+      slides[currentSlide].classList.remove('active-slide');
+      slides[n].classList.add('active-slide');
+      currentSlide = n;
+      if(currentSlide === 0){
+        previousButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+      else{
+        previousButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      if(currentSlide === slides.length-1){
+        nextButton.style.display = 'none';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      else{
+        nextButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+    }
+  
+    function showNextSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide + 1);
+    }
+  
+    function showPreviousSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide - 1);
+    }
+  
+    // Variables
+    const quizContainer = document.getElementById('quiz');
+    const resultsContainer = document.getElementById('results');
+    const submitButton = document.getElementById('submit');
+    const myQuestions = [
+      {
+        question: "What is an Honour’s Degree?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "An intensive year of full-time study you can take after your bachelor’s degree, involving both coursework and research components.",
+          b: "A knighting from the queen",
+          c: "The temperature of Sweden"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "a"
+      },
+      {
+        question: "Honour’s requires you to submit a ___________ in ",
+        answers: {
+          a: "15,000-word dissertation",
+          b: "Live performance video",
+          c: "Fully developed website"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "a"
+      },
+      {
+        question:"True or False: Master’s degrees can be considered as an extension of your undergraduate degree",
+        answers: {
+          a: "True",
+          b: "False",
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "a"
+      },
+      {
+        question: "True or False: Master’s degrees can only be done by coursework.",
+        answers: {
+          a: "True",
+          b: "False",
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "b"
+      },
+
+      {
+        question: "What is a PhD?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "A course that you undertake after your Honour’s/Master’s involving independent research on a certain field of study.",
+          b: "Hotdog",
+          c: "A doctor",
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "a"
+      }
+    ];
+  
+    // Kick things off
+    buildQuiz();
+  
+    // Pagination
+    const previousButton = document.getElementById("previous");
+    const nextButton = document.getElementById("next");
+    const slides = document.querySelectorAll(".slideQuiz");
+    let currentSlide = 0;
+  
+    // Show the first slide
+    showSlide(currentSlide);
+  
+    // Event listeners
+    submitButton.addEventListener('click', showResults);
+    previousButton.addEventListener("click", showPreviousSlide);
+    nextButton.addEventListener("click", showNextSlide);
+})();
\ No newline at end of file

diff --git a/app/static/Scripts/additionalquiz.js b/app/static/Scripts/additionalquiz.js
index e69de29..c115787 100644
--- a/app/static/Scripts/additionalquiz.js
+++ b/app/static/Scripts/additionalquiz.js
@@ -0,0 +1,153 @@
+(function(){
+    // Functions
+    function buildQuiz(){
+      // variable to store the HTML output
+      const output = [];
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach(
+        (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+          // variable to store the list of possible answers
+          const answers = [];
+  
+          // and for each available answer...
+          for(letter in currentQuestion.answers){
+  
+            // ...add an HTML radio button
+            answers.push(
+              `<label>
+                <input type="radio" name="question${questionNumber}" value="${letter}">
+                ${letter} :
+                ${currentQuestion.answers[letter]}
+              </label>`
+            );
+          }
+  
+          // add this question and its answers to the output
+          output.push(
+            `<div class="slideQuiz">
+              <div class="question"> ${currentQuestion.question} </div>
+              <div class="answers"> ${answers.join("")} </div>
+            </div>`
+          );
+        }
+      );
+  
+      // finally combine our output list into one string of HTML and put it on the page
+      quizContainer.innerHTML = output.join('');
+    }
+  
+    function showResults(){
+  
+      // gather answer containers from our quiz
+      const answerContainers = quizContainer.querySelectorAll('.answers');
+  
+      // keep track of user's answers
+      let numCorrect = 0;
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach( (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+        // find selected answer
+        const answerContainer = answerContainers[questionNumber];
+        const selector = `input[name=question${questionNumber}]:checked`;
+        const userAnswer = (answerContainer.querySelector(selector) || {}).value;
+  
+        // if answer is correct
+        if(userAnswer === currentQuestion.correctAnswer){
+          // add to the number of correct answers
+          numCorrect++;
+  
+          // color the answers green
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'lightgreen';
+        }
+        // if answer is wrong or blank
+        else{
+          // color the answers red
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'red';
+        }
+      });
+  
+      // show number of correct answers out of total
+      resultsContainer.innerHTML = `${numCorrect} out of ${myQuestions.length} correct`;
+    }
+  
+    function showSlide(n) {
+      slides[currentSlide].classList.remove('active-slide');
+      slides[n].classList.add('active-slide');
+      currentSlide = n;
+      if(currentSlide === 0){
+        previousButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+      else{
+        previousButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      if(currentSlide === slides.length-1){
+        nextButton.style.display = 'none';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      else{
+        nextButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+    }
+  
+    function showNextSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide + 1);
+    }
+  
+    function showPreviousSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide - 1);
+    }
+  
+    // Variables
+    const quizContainer = document.getElementById('quiz');
+    const resultsContainer = document.getElementById('results');
+    const submitButton = document.getElementById('submit');
+    const myQuestions = [
+      {
+        question: "How many transfer windows are there, if you wish to change majors?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "111",
+          b: "Nine",
+          c: "Two"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "c"
+      },
+      {
+        question: "True or False: Are you forced to redo the units if the coursebook changes?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "True",
+          b: "False",
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "b"
+      },
+      {
+        question:"Who should you contact if you are thinking of switching courses?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "Your mate in class",
+          b: "Your Student Advising Office",
+          c: "Tim French"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "b"
+      },
+    ];
+  
+    // Kick things off
+    buildQuiz();
+  
+    // Pagination
+    const previousButton = document.getElementById("previous");
+    const nextButton = document.getElementById("next");
+    const slides = document.querySelectorAll(".slideQuiz");
+    let currentSlide = 0;
+  
+    // Show the first slide
+    showSlide(currentSlide);
+  
+    // Event listeners
+    submitButton.addEventListener('click', showResults);
+    previousButton.addEventListener("click", showPreviousSlide);
+    nextButton.addEventListener("click", showNextSlide);
+})();

diff --git a/app/static/Scripts/enrolmentquiz.js b/app/static/Scripts/enrolmentquiz.js
index e69de29..7e5d5b4 100644
--- a/app/static/Scripts/enrolmentquiz.js
+++ b/app/static/Scripts/enrolmentquiz.js
@@ -0,0 +1,173 @@
+(function(){
+    // Functions
+    function buildQuiz(){
+      // variable to store the HTML output
+      const output = [];
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach(
+        (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+          // variable to store the list of possible answers
+          const answers = [];
+  
+          // and for each available answer...
+          for(letter in currentQuestion.answers){
+  
+            // ...add an HTML radio button
+            answers.push(
+              `<label>
+                <input type="radio" name="question${questionNumber}" value="${letter}">
+                ${letter} :
+                ${currentQuestion.answers[letter]}
+              </label>`
+            );
+          }
+  
+          // add this question and its answers to the output
+          output.push(
+            `<div class="slideQuiz">
+              <div class="question"> ${currentQuestion.question} </div>
+              <div class="answers"> ${answers.join("")} </div>
+            </div>`
+          );
+        }
+      );
+  
+      // finally combine our output list into one string of HTML and put it on the page
+      quizContainer.innerHTML = output.join('');
+    }
+  
+    function showResults(){
+  
+      // gather answer containers from our quiz
+      const answerContainers = quizContainer.querySelectorAll('.answers');
+  
+      // keep track of user's answers
+      let numCorrect = 0;
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach( (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+        // find selected answer
+        const answerContainer = answerContainers[questionNumber];
+        const selector = `input[name=question${questionNumber}]:checked`;
+        const userAnswer = (answerContainer.querySelector(selector) || {}).value;
+  
+        // if answer is correct
+        if(userAnswer === currentQuestion.correctAnswer){
+          // add to the number of correct answers
+          numCorrect++;
+  
+          // color the answers green
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'lightgreen';
+        }
+        // if answer is wrong or blank
+        else{
+          // color the answers red
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'red';
+        }
+      });
+  
+      // show number of correct answers out of total
+      resultsContainer.innerHTML = `${numCorrect} out of ${myQuestions.length} correct`;
+    }
+  
+    function showSlide(n) {
+      slides[currentSlide].classList.remove('active-slide');
+      slides[n].classList.add('active-slide');
+      currentSlide = n;
+      if(currentSlide === 0){
+        previousButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+      else{
+        previousButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      if(currentSlide === slides.length-1){
+        nextButton.style.display = 'none';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      else{
+        nextButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+    }
+  
+    function showNextSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide + 1);
+    }
+  
+    function showPreviousSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide - 1);
+    }
+  
+    // Variables
+    const quizContainer = document.getElementById('quiz');
+    const resultsContainer = document.getElementById('results');
+    const submitButton = document.getElementById('submit');
+    const myQuestions = [
+      {
+        question: "What should you have handy to help you plan out your course when beginning to enrol online?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "Transperth Journey Planner",
+          b: "Study plan",
+          c: "A pencil"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "b"
+      },
+      {
+        question: "If you began your course in 2022 and did 4 units per semester, which year would you graduate?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "End of 2024",
+          b: "Start of 2025",
+          c: "End of 1950"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "a"
+      },
+      {
+        question:"What is CAS?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "Casino",
+          b: "Class Allocation System",
+          c: "CostCo"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "b"
+      },
+      {
+        question: "From where can you get your campus card at UWA?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "The Ref",
+          b: "Business School",
+          c: "Student Central"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "c"
+      },
+
+      {
+        question: "If you’re a domestic student wanting to apply for the HECS-HELP loan scheme, what do you need?",
+        answers: {
+          a: "Tax File Number",
+          b: "Account Number & BSB",
+          c: "Three numbers at the back of your card",
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "a"
+      }
+    ];
+  
+    // Kick things off
+    buildQuiz();
+  
+    // Pagination
+    const previousButton = document.getElementById("previous");
+    const nextButton = document.getElementById("next");
+    const slides = document.querySelectorAll(".slideQuiz");
+    let currentSlide = 0;
+  
+    // Show the first slide
+    showSlide(currentSlide);
+  
+    // Event listeners
+    submitButton.addEventListener('click', showResults);
+    previousButton.addEventListener("click", showPreviousSlide);
+    nextButton.addEventListener("click", showNextSlide);
+})();
\ No newline at end of file

     return draggableElements.reduce((closest, child) => {
         const box = child.getBoundingClientRect()
         const offset = x - box.left - box.width / 2
-        console.log(offset);
         if (offset <0 && offset > closest.offset) {
             return { offset: offset, element: child}
         } else {
             return closest
         }
     }, {offset: Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY}).element

+  
+  /* Adds a slightly darker color to the hoevered major*/
+  .majorlist a:hover {background-color: #ddd;}
+  
+  /* On hover, will show the major list*/
+  .dropdown:hover .majorlist {display: block;}
+  
+  /* Changes color of containing div on hover*/
+  .dropdown:hover .majors {background-color:rgb(161, 137, 1);}
\ No newline at end of file

+from flask import Flask
+
+app = Flask(__name__)
+
+from app import routes
\ No newline at end of file
diff --git a/app/routes.py b/app/routes.py
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..b5c312a
--- /dev/null
+++ b/app/routes.py
@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@
+from app import app
+from flask import render_template
+
+@app.route("/")
+def login():
+    return render_template("welcome-login.html")
+
+@app.route("/register")
+def register():
+    return render_template("welcome-registration.html")
+
+@app.route("/profile")
+def profile():
+    return render_template("profile.html", title="Profile")
+
+@app.route("/content-changing-degrees")
+def contentChangeDegree():
+    return render_template("")
+
+@app.route("/content-definitions")
+def contentDefinitions():
+    return render_template("contentDefinitions.html")
+
+@app.route("/content-enrolment")
+def contentEnrolment():
+    return render_template("contentEnrolment.html")
+
+@app.route("/content-postgrad")
+def contentPostgrad():
+    return render_template("contentPostgrad.html")
+
+@app.route("/content-undergrad")
+def contentUndergrad():
+    return render_template("contentUndergrad.html")
+
+@app.route("/home-page")
+def homePage():
+    return render_template("homePage.html")
+
+@app.route("/quiz-homepage")
+def quizHome():
+    return render_template("quizHomepage.html")
+
+@app.route("/quiz-undergrad")
+def quizUndergrad():
+    return render_template("quizUndergrad.html")
+
+@app.route("/quiz-handbook")
+def quizHandbook():
+    return render_template("quizHandbook.html")
+
+if __name__=="__main__":
+    app.run(debug=True)

+from flask import render_template
+from app import app
+
+@app.route("/")
+def login():
+    return render_template("welcome-login.html")
+
+@app.route("/register")
+def register():
+    return render_template("welcome-registration.html")
+
+@app.route("/profile")
+def profile():
+    return render_template("profile.html", title="Profile")
+
+@app.route("/content-changing-degrees")
+def contentChangeDegree():
+    return render_template("")
+
+@app.route("/content-definitions")
+def contentDefinitions():
+    return render_template("contentDefinitions.html")
+
+@app.route("/content-enrolment")
+def contentEnrolment():
+    return render_template("contentEnrolment.html")
+
+@app.route("/content-postgrad")
+def contentPostgrad():
+    return render_template("contentPostgrad.html")
+
+@app.route("/content-undergrad")
+def contentUndergrad():
+    return render_template("contentUndergrad.html")
+
+@app.route("/home-page")
+def homePage():
+    return render_template("homePage.html")
+
+@app.route("/quiz-homepage")
+def quizHome():
+    return render_template("quizHomepage.html")
+
+@app.route("/quiz-undergrad")
+def quizUndergrad():
+    return render_template("quizUndergrad.html")
+
+@app.route("/quiz-handbook")
+def quizHandbook():
+    return render_template("quizHandbook.html")
+
+if __name__=="__main__":
+    app.run(debug=True)

diff --git a/app/static/Scripts/quiz.js b/app/static/Scripts/quiz.js
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..42add74
--- /dev/null
+++ b/app/static/Scripts/quiz.js
@@ -0,0 +1,155 @@
+(function(){
+    // Functions
+    function buildQuiz(){
+      // variable to store the HTML output
+      const output = [];
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach(
+        (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+          // variable to store the list of possible answers
+          const answers = [];
+  
+          // and for each available answer...
+          for(letter in currentQuestion.answers){
+  
+            // ...add an HTML radio button
+            answers.push(
+              `<label>
+                <input type="radio" name="question${questionNumber}" value="${letter}">
+                ${letter} :
+                ${currentQuestion.answers[letter]}
+              </label>`
+            );
+          }
+  
+          // add this question and its answers to the output
+          output.push(
+            `<div class="slideQuiz">
+              <div class="question"> ${currentQuestion.question} </div>
+              <div class="answers"> ${answers.join("")} </div>
+            </div>`
+          );
+        }
+      );
+  
+      // finally combine our output list into one string of HTML and put it on the page
+      quizContainer.innerHTML = output.join('');
+    }
+  
+    function showResults(){
+  
+      // gather answer containers from our quiz
+      const answerContainers = quizContainer.querySelectorAll('.answers');
+  
+      // keep track of user's answers
+      let numCorrect = 0;
+  
+      // for each question...
+      myQuestions.forEach( (currentQuestion, questionNumber) => {
+  
+        // find selected answer
+        const answerContainer = answerContainers[questionNumber];
+        const selector = `input[name=question${questionNumber}]:checked`;
+        const userAnswer = (answerContainer.querySelector(selector) || {}).value;
+  
+        // if answer is correct
+        if(userAnswer === currentQuestion.correctAnswer){
+          // add to the number of correct answers
+          numCorrect++;
+  
+          // color the answers green
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'lightgreen';
+        }
+        // if answer is wrong or blank
+        else{
+          // color the answers red
+          answerContainers[questionNumber].style.color = 'red';
+        }
+      });
+  
+      // show number of correct answers out of total
+      resultsContainer.innerHTML = `${numCorrect} out of ${myQuestions.length}`;
+    }
+  
+    function showSlide(n) {
+      slides[currentSlide].classList.remove('active-slide');
+      slides[n].classList.add('active-slide');
+      currentSlide = n;
+      if(currentSlide === 0){
+        previousButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+      else{
+        previousButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      if(currentSlide === slides.length-1){
+        nextButton.style.display = 'none';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+      }
+      else{
+        nextButton.style.display = 'inline-block';
+        submitButton.style.display = 'none';
+      }
+    }
+  
+    function showNextSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide + 1);
+    }
+  
+    function showPreviousSlide() {
+      showSlide(currentSlide - 1);
+    }
+  
+    // Variables
+    const quizContainer = document.getElementById('quiz');
+    const resultsContainer = document.getElementById('results');
+    const submitButton = document.getElementById('submit');
+    const myQuestions = [
+      {
+        question: "placeholder Q",
+        answers: {
+          a: "placeholder answer",
+          b: "placeholder answer",
+          c: "placeholder answer"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "c"
+      },
+      {
+        question: "Placeholder q",
+        answers: {
+          a: "placeholder answer",
+          b: "placeholder answer",
+          c: "placeholder answer"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "a"
+      },
+      {
+        question: "Who is an undergrad",
+        answers: {
+          a: "placeholder answer",
+          b: "placeholder answer",
+          c: "placeholder answer",
+          d: "placeholder answer"
+        },
+        correctAnswer: "d"
+      }
+    ];
+  
+    // Kick things off
+    buildQuiz();
+  
+    // Pagination
+    const previousButton = document.getElementById("previous");
+    const nextButton = document.getElementById("next");
+    const slides = document.querySelectorAll(".slide");
+    let currentSlide = 0;
+  
+    // Show the first slide
+    showSlide(currentSlide);
+  
+    // Event listeners
+    submitButton.addEventListener('click', showResults);
+    previousButton.addEventListener("click", showPreviousSlide);
+    nextButton.addEventListener("click", showNextSlide);
+  })();
\ No newline at end of file

+    font-size: 17px;

+    margin-top: 5px;

+    right: 0%;
+}

+    font-size: 30px;
+    margin-bottom: 10px;

+    margin-bottom: 20px;
+    text-align: left;

+    display: block;

+    position: relative;
+    height: 200px;
+    margin-top: 40px;

diff --git a/app/templates/contentDefinitions.html b/app/templates/contentDefinitions.html
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..a46da81
--- /dev/null
+++ b/app/templates/contentDefinitions.html
@@ -0,0 +1,115 @@
+{%extends "base.html" %}
+{%block head%}
+        <style>
+            a {
+                text-decoration:underline;
+                color:lightblue;
+            }
+            .def-text {
+                font-weight:bold;
+                font-style:italic;
+                text-decoration: underline;
+            }
+        </style>
+{%endblock%}
+{%block body%}
+        <div class="center" style="text-align:center; margin:25px 50px 0px 50px">
+            <h1 style="color:rgba(39,52,139,255)"> Additional Information and Course Definitions  </h1>
+            <p style="margin-top:20px; margin-left:150px; margin-right:150px; font-size:20px;"> As a final part of our How-To guide on enrolling at UWA, here's a few more things you should know about changing courses and course adjustments, as well as a library of definitions to look at if you're unsure on anything that we've discussed in previous sections. </p>
+        </div>
+        <div id="myCarousel" class="carousel slide" data-ride="carousel" data-interval="false">
+            <ol class="carousel-indicators">
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="0" class="active"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="1"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="2"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="3"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="4"></li>
+            </ol>
+            <div class="carousel-inner">
+              <div class="carousel-item active">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="First slide" >
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> Changing Majors/Degrees </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:12px; font-size:16.5px;">
+                        <p> If at any point during your degree you wish to change your major, log into your studentconnect and change the unit set of the major(s) that you are currently enrolled into the major that you wish to change to. </p>
+                        <ul>
+                            <li> Please keep in mind that changing your major may extend the duration of your degree according to the units that you have already undertaken and have to undertake. </li>
+                            <li> Many first-year units in degrees such as the Bachelor of Biomedical Science are shared and changing major will often have no consequence, however this is often and not always the case, especially if you are also changing your degree to another field of study. </li>
+                        </ul>
+                        <p> If you wish to change your course as an undergraduate student, you have two transfer “windows” per year to transfer to another eligible undergraduate course (if you meet the prerequisites for that course). This application is easy to complete and is available online via studentconnect. </p>
+                        <p> If you wish to speak to someone if you are considering changing course, you may contact your Student Advising Office (specific for each faculty, you can find your SAO when you login to studentconnect online) or speak to a Careers Advisor (appointments can be made through the Careers Centre (careers.uwa.edu.au) </p>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+              </div>
+                <div class="carousel-item">
+                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Second slide">
+                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                        <h1 style="margin-top:10px; font-size:32px;"> Changes in Course Structure During Your Degree </h1>
+                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
+                            <p> If a certain major that you are undertaking changes the degrees in its course structure, either by removing them entirely or changing a prerequisite for that major, you are able to contact your degree’s faculty office at UWA (e.g. School of Science for Bachelor of Science) and ask them to keep you enrolled in the course in the year that you first began the major. </p> <br>
+                            <ul>
+                                <li> For example, if I began my degree majoring in Data Science as my degree-specific major in 2019, and I have undertaken units that are now removed from the course, I have the option of continuing the course as it was in 2019 or 2020.</li>
+                                <li> Keep in mind that you must consult with your student office (e.g. Faculty of Science) to put this into effect. </li>
+                            </ul>
+                        </div>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+            <div class="carousel-item">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Third slide">
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px; font-size:32px;"> Definitions #1 </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
+                        <p> The next few slides are a resource of definitions of the course terminology that we have discussed in all previous parts of the course. Feel free to browse as a refresher if there are parts of our tutorial that you did not understand. </p>
+                        <p> Most of these definitions have been sourced from UWA and credit goes to the university. </p>
+                        <ul> 
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Majors</span>: A major is a structured sequence of units in a particular discipline or field of study. It provides you with the opportunity to develop the knowledge, understanding and expertise that will equip you to move into a rewarding career after graduation or to pursue further study in a similar area at postgraduate level. You can choose a degree-specific major and a second major if you wish.  </li>
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Minors</span>: Minors are smaller unit sets that are composed of four units that you can optionally include as part of your course. These are much like majors, however they are much shorter. </li>
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Core Units</span>: Core units are the compulsory units in your major. Some majors are made up entirely of core units whereas others allow you to choose from a selection of options. The core units that you must do also depend on whether that major is your course-specific major or your second major. </li>
+                        </ul>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+            </div>
+            <div class="carousel-item">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Fourth slide">
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px; font-size:32px;"> Definitions #2 </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
+                        <ul> 
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Degree-Specific Major </span>: Each three-year undergraduate degree has its own degree-specific majors, and you must complete at least one degree-specific major from your course.  </li>
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Second Majors </span>: If you wish to do a second major you can. As a result, however, you will have less electives throughout your undergrad degree since they will replace the credit space you are able to take. </li>
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Complementary Units </span>: Some degree-specific majors require you to study complementary units that provide important additional knowledge and expertise in particular areas or allow you to fill gaps in your knowledge that will be required to successfully complete the major. Up to four complementary units may be specified, though many degree-specific majors have fewer, and some prescribe none. </li>
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Electives </span>: Units that provide you with the opportunity to explore a range of interests and new disciplines. If you structure your degree with one degree-specific major, there is potential for up to 12 electives. If you decide to study two majors there is still room for variety beyond your majors. </li>
+                        </ul>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+            </div>
+            <div class="carousel-item">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Fifth slide">
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px; font-size:32px;"> Definitions #3 </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
+                        <ul> 
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Credits </span>: Each of your units is worth a number of credit points. Most units are worth six points; a small number of project units are worth 12 points each. In order to complete your undergraduate degree you need to complete units worth a total of 144 credit points. The credit points for each unit are listed in its Handbook entry. </li>
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Levels </span>: All units are assigned a Level which indicates the amount of prior knowledge or maturity of learning required to study the unit successfully. Undergraduate units are classified into three levels. Level 1 units are entry-level or introductory units. You can progress to Level 2 or Level 3 units as soon as you meet the prerequisites and any other unit rules. </li>
+                            <li><span class="def-text"> Full-Time and Part-Time Study </span>: Full-time study is defined as undertaking 3+ units a semester. Part-time study is defined as undertaking 1-2 maximum. </li>
+                        </ul>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+            </div>
+            <a class="carousel-control-prev" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="prev">
+              <span class="carousel-control-prev-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
+              <span class="sr-only">Previous</span>
+            </a>
+            <a class="carousel-control-next" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="next">
+              <span class="carousel-control-next-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
+              <span class="sr-only">Next</span>
+            </a>
+            </div>
+        </div>
+{%endblock%}
+</html>
\ No newline at end of file

+++ b/app/templates/contentEnrolment.html
@@ -0,0 +1,87 @@
+{%extends "base.html" %}
+{%block head%}
+        <style>
+            a {
+                text-decoration:underline;
+                color:lightblue;
+            }
+            .def-text {
+                font-weight:bold;
+                font-style:italic;
+                text-decoration: underline;
+            }
+        </style>
+{%endblock%}
+{%block body%}
+        <div class="center" style="text-align:center; margin:25px 50px 0px 50px">
+            <h1 style="color:rgba(39,52,139,255)"> Enrolling in Your First Undergraduate Degree </h1>
+            <p style="margin-top:20px; margin-left:150px; margin-right:150px; font-size:20px;"> Now that we've learnt all about course requirements, units and majors, let's enrol for our first undergraduate degree! </p>
+        </div>
+        <div id="myCarousel" class="carousel slide" data-ride="carousel" data-interval="false">
+            <ol class="carousel-indicators">
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="0" class="active"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="1"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="2"></li>
+            </ol>
+            <div class="carousel-inner">
+              <div class="carousel-item active">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="First slide" >
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> Enrolling on StudentConnect </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:12px; font-size:16px;">
+                        <p> Now that we're all set up, the next step is to simply enrol in our course on UWA's online student hub, StudentConnect. </p>
+                        <p> Start by logging into the StudentConnect site which can be found 
+                                <a href="https://www.uwa.edu.au/students" target="_blank"> here. </a></p>
+                        <ol>
+                            <li> Navigate to COURSE DETAILS > Online enrolment and click on "Begin online enrolment". </li>
+                            <li> Firstly, enter your nominated graduation year and completion period – for most people this would be 3 years (inclusive) from the time you begin your degree. For example, if you began your course in 2022, you would graduate at the end of 2024. </li>
+                            <li> Next, you may select your Unit Sets which relates to your major and second major. You will select your degree-specific major and your second degree major. </li>
+                            <li style="margin-bottom:5px;"> Now refer to your study plan that we made in the previous guide. You will now select your units. You can search up units according to their unit code – e.g., CITS1401. Once you have all the units selected for both semesters 1 and 2, then checkout and those units will now be selected as the first units of your course. Consider first year sorted! </li>
+                        </ol>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+              </div>
+            <div class="carousel-item">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Second slide">
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> Class Allocation System </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:25px; font-size:16px;">
+                        <p> Now all that is left is for you to sort out your University timetable on UWA’s class allocation system, also known as CAS. You can access CAS at cas.uwa.edu.au. You can select preferences up to four for which times you would like certain classes (tutorials, labs, workshops, etc.) to be allocated for you. Certain classes such as lectures are often not changeable. </p>
+                        <p> The Class Allocation System will look like the image below. Click on this image to be directed to the CAS UWA website. </p>
+                        <a href="https://www.cas.uwa.edu.au/" target="_blank">
+                            <img style="display:block; width:50%; height:255px; margin-right:auto; margin-left:auto;" src="Images/CASexampleimage.png" alt="CAS Example">
+                        </a>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+            </div>
+            <div class="carousel-item">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Third slide">
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> What's Next? </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:25px;">
+                        <ul>
+                            <li> Congratulations! Now that you’ve finished enrolling at UWA, you can look into getting your own Campus Card! This can be done in-person from Student Central at UWA and the process begins online through studentconnect. </li>
+                            <li> Next, you have the freedom to access your very own student email which, as of 2020, is available on Microsoft Outlook and can also be accessed through studentconnect. </li>
+                            <li> Other things that you can now do involve making your own USI (Unique Student Identifier) and applying for the HECS-HELP loan scheme if you are a domestic student and wish to apply for governmental support for payment of your university course. You will need your tax-file number for this step and the setup is accessible once again through studentconnect. </li>
+                            <li> Finally, attend orientation! Before University begins in February each year, there is a week of orientation for new students to explore the campus, get involved with University Clubs and learn about their course. The key dates for orientation are available on the Unistart website
+                                <a href="https://www.uwa.edu.au/unistart/orientation" target="_blank"> here. </a>
+                            </li>
+                        </ul>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+            </div>
+            <a class="carousel-control-prev" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="prev">
+              <span class="carousel-control-prev-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
+              <span class="sr-only">Previous</span>
+            </a>
+            <a class="carousel-control-next" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="next">
+              <span class="carousel-control-next-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
+              <span class="sr-only">Next</span>
+            </a>
+            </div>
+        </div>
+{%endblock%}
+</html>

+{%extends "base.html" %}
+{%block head%}
+        <style>
+            a {
+                text-decoration:underline;
+                color:lightblue;
+            }
+            .def-text {
+                font-weight:bold;
+                font-style:italic;
+                text-decoration: underline;
+            }
+        </style>
+{%endblock%}
+{%blockbody%} 
+        <div class="center" style="text-align:center; margin:25px 50px 0px 50px">
+            <h1 style="color:rgba(39,52,139,255)"> Postgraduate Degrees at UWA  </h1>
+            <p style="margin-top:20px; margin-left:150px; margin-right:150px; font-size:20px;"> Once you've begun doing your undergraduate degree, you may start thinking about continuing your degree in postgrad. In this section we'll be learning all about the types of Postgraduate degrees that UWA offers to continue your study journey at UWA! </p>
+        </div>
+        <div id="myCarousel" class="carousel slide" data-ride="carousel" data-interval="false">
+            <ol class="carousel-indicators">
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="0" class="active"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="1"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="2"></li>
+              <li data-target="#myCarousel" data-slide-to="3"></li>
+            </ol>
+            <div class="carousel-inner">
+              <div class="carousel-item active">
+                <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="First slide">
+                <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                    <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> Introduction to Postgrad </h1>
+                    <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:12px;">
+                        <p> Once you have graduated and completed your undergraduate course, you have the option of undertaking a postgraduate degree! </p> <br>
+                        <ul>
+                            <li> Applications to postgraduate degrees can be completed on the UWA website and can be completed either in your final year/semester of study or even after you have graduated. </li>
+                                <li style="margin-left:30px;"> Ensure that you read all your chosen postgraduate course’s requirements before enrolling. </li>
+                                <li style="margin-left:30px;"> Each postgraduate course at UWA has their own specific requirements based on prerequisites, academic performance and English competency and can be viewed on the postgraduate handbooks at 
+                                    <a href="https://handbooks.uwa.edu.au/" target="_blank"> handbooks.uwa.edu.au </a> </li>
+                            <li> This includes Honours or Master’s and continues onto a PhD once you have completed Honours or Master's. </li>
+                                <li style="margin-left:30px;"> Continue onto the next slide to learn about Honours and Master's courses at UWA. </li>
+                        </ul>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+              </div>
+                <div class="carousel-item">
+                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Second slide">
+                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                        <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> Honours </h1>
+                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
+                            <p> At most Australian universities, Honours is an additional year of study that you can take at the end of your three-year bachelor’s degree course and involves a year of full-time study including both research and coursework components. </p> <br>
+                            <ul>
+                                <li> It involves eight level 4 units and a written dissertation of approximately 15,000 words which is completed over two consecutive semesters. </li>
+                                    <li style="margin-left:30px;"> This is an intensive year of study and has a heavier study load than an undergraduate degree. </li>
+                                <li> If you are considering a future in research or wish to complete more in your time at university, an honours degree will give you valuable skills in problem-solving, critical thinking, independent learning, and communication. </li>
+                            </ul>
+                        </div>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+                <div class="carousel-item">
+                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Third slide">
+                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                        <h1 style="margin-top:10px;"> Master's </h1>
+                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
+                            <p> Master’s degrees can be completed by coursework, coursework and these or dissertation or just research. </p> <br>
+                            <ul>
+                                <li> Coursework simply means that you complete your master’s degree with the only requirement that you complete the units in your master’s up to the required number of credit points.  </li>
+                                <li> Masters by research (thesis and/or dissertation) means that you must submit a final paper either by itself or in conjunction with the coursework that you complete for that master’s degree (depending on whether you undertake a master’s by coursework and research or a master’s by research only). </li>
+                                <li> Master’s degrees can be considered as an extension of your undergraduate degree and can be useful in teaching you more about your field of study after your undergraduate and increasing your employability in that field.  </li>
+                            </ul>
+                        </div>
+                    </div>
+                </div>
+                <div class="carousel-item">
+                    <img class="d-block w-75 caro-image" src="https://www.web.uwa.edu.au/__data/assets/image/0018/2282004/centenary_year.jpg" alt="Fourth slide">
+                    <img class="d block caro-image-overlap" src="https://www.colorhexa.com/27348b.png" alt="background-image">
+                    <div class="carousel-caption" style="color:white;">
+                        <h1 style="margin-top:10px; font-size:32px;"> Differences Between Honours, Master's and PhD </h1>
+                        <div class="caro-text" style="margin-top:20px;">
+                            <p> The main difference between the two typically lies in the type of work you do throughout the course and the duration of the course. </p>
+                            <ul>
+                                <li> Master’s courses are typically 1.5-2 years and can be done by coursework, coursework and dissertation/thesis or by thesis only. </li>
+                                <li> Honours courses are 1 year in duration and involve both coursework and a written dissertation. </li>
+                                <li> Additionally, a PhD is a course that you undertake after your Honours/Masters and involves a “program of independent, supervised research that is assessed solely on the basis of a thesis that is examined externally”. </li>
+                                    <li style="margin-left:30px;"> These are often 4+ year long courses that involve independent research on a certain field of study and are the highest level of degree that you can obtain. </li>
+                            </ul>
+                        </div>
+                    </div> 
+                </div>
+            <a class="carousel-control-prev" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="prev">
+              <span class="carousel-control-prev-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
+              <span class="sr-only">Previous</span>
+            </a>
+            <a class="carousel-control-next" href="#myCarousel" role="button" data-slide="next">
+              <span class="carousel-control-next-icon" aria-hidden="true"></span>
+              <span class="sr-only">Next</span>
+            </a>
+            </div>
+        </div>
+{%endblock%}
+</html>
